comment.author: 33174579@N03
comment._content: Hm... my guess is that this is the family of James Connolly including his wife and his five kids. The girl standing beside James Connolly could be Nora Connolly O'Brien.

comment.author: 60523423@N05
comment._content: Interesting, none of the other photos of Connolly show a cleft chin, & this one appears to, I'm not sure if that can develop in adulthood.

comment.author: 53651526@N00
comment._content: Whoever it is, it's a brilliant photograph.

comment.author: 15172664@N03
comment._content: wow they must have spent some time in the bathroom in the mornings getting dressed!

comment.author: 64536982@N04
comment._content: Odd but funny gentleman with the beard in back row not facing forward like others

comment.author: 32465819@N05
comment._content: So enjoyed wading through your stream of wonderful photos ... thanks for sharing them!

comment.author: 22575440@N07
comment._content: is it me or aren't those 2 women posed unusually on the chaise lounge?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/tammybeck] It's not you, it's them! Prize for most bizarre studio pose in our collections goes to these two ladies...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 49615044@N03
comment._content: gosh!  incredible!  the lad in front row, left, is the spittin image of a lad I knew in my childhood days, so very long ago, whose name was O'Brien.

comment.author: 107038183@N04
comment._content: odd looking at the two on the lounge makes me wonder if the one on the left is a man wearing a long kilt or blanket. has a tie around the neck and a jacket with lapels

comment.author: 107038183@N04
comment._content: An unusual pose for sure. It looks to me like the one on the left could be a man (with a tie and lapels on the jacket) wearing a blanket over his legs or a kilt of some type
